dt: {bc}rigorously conforming to principle or a norm or condition

dt.t: in the {wi}strict{/wi} sense of the word

pt: {sc}rigid{/sc} {sc}rigorous{/sc} {sc}strict{/sc} {sc}stringent{/sc} mean extremely severe or stern. {sc}rigid{/sc} implies uncompromising inflexibility.
{sc}rigorous{/sc} implies the imposition of hardship and difficulty.
{sc}strict{/sc} emphasizes undeviating conformity to rules, standards, or requirements.
{sc}stringent{/sc} suggests severe, tight restriction or limitation.

et: Middle English {it}stricte{/it}, from Latin {it}strictus{/it}, from past participle of {it}stringere{/it} to bind tight {ma}{mat|strain|}{/ma}

shortdef: liability imposed without regard to fault

dt: {bc}not made known to the public or other people {bc}private

dt.t: Your personal information will be kept {it}in strict/strictest confidence{/it}.

shortdef: not made known to the public or other people : private

dt: used to refer to using the correct or precise meaning of a word
